categories.name: Legends of the Pitch: Famous Soccer Moments

questions.clue: In 1966, this country won its first and only FIFA World Cup on home soil. It remains a 'lions' achievement in their football history.
Dubbed 'The Hand of God,' this soccer legend used his hand to score a controversial goal against England in the 1986 World Cup.
In the 2000 UEFA European Championship final, this country's team emerged victorious with a golden goal by David Trezeguet.
This African nation, known as the 'Indomitable Lions', made history by reaching the quarter-finals of the 1990 FIFA World Cup.
In 2019, this U.S. Women's National Team player scored a hat trick in the World Cup final, leading to their fourth title and cementing her legendary status.

categories.name: The Big Cats: Majestic Predators of the World

questions.clue: This big cat, known as the 'king of the jungle,' actually lives in grasslands and savannas.
This spotted big cat is renowned for its incredible speed, reaching up to 75 mph in short bursts.
Unlike most big cats, this powerful swimmer is known to prey on crocodiles and is found in the Americas.
The Amur, or Siberian, type of this big cat boasts the largest and heaviest members of the feline family.
This secretive big cat thrives in the snow-covered mountains of Central Asia, known for its long tail and camouflage.

categories.name: Historical Headlines: Global Events of the Last Century

questions.clue: In 1969, this country sported headlines about a 'Giant Leap for Mankind'.
1972 saw watershed headlines in sports when this U.S. swimmer won 7 gold medals at the Munich Olympics.
Headlines roared in 1989 as the Soviet Union left this Central Asian country, ending a nearly decade-long conflict.
In 1997, newspapers reported on this British royal's tragic car accident in Paris.
Headlines were filled with global concern in 2001 when China joined this international economic organization.

categories.name: Journey Through the Solar System: Exploring Our Cosmic Neighborhood

questions.clue: For 200 points: This 'Red Planet' is famous for its reddish appearance and is the fourth planet from the Sun.
For 400 points: Known for its large rings, this planet is the second-largest in our solar system.
For 600 points: This planet is famous for its Great Red Spot, a giant storm larger than Earth.
For 800 points: Named after the Roman god of the sea, this blue planet is the farthest from the Sun.
For 1000 points: The smallest planet in our solar system, it's named after the Roman messenger god and has the most eccentric orbit.

categories.name: The Art of Protest: Influential Music and Movements

questions.clue: This famous song by Bob Dylan, released in 1964, became an anthem for the civil rights movement.
In 1985, numerous artists joined forces to record 'We Are the World,' organized to fight this crisis in Africa.
This 1970 anti-Vietnam War anthem by Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young was inspired by the Kent State shootings.
Public Enemy's 1989 album featuring 'Fight the Power' challenged listeners to combat racial injustice and was produced during this era of hip-hop.
Portrayed in a 2021 biopic, this 1970s song by Gil Scott-Heron highlighted systemic racism and became known as an early work of hip-hop.

final.clue: This NFL team's mascot is a big cat, and it's named after one of the four major battles of the 20th century its city is known for hosting.
